FL.content: via Benjamin, the threat of the law (to itself and outwards) is neither intimidation nor dissuasion (as pacifists, anarchists or activists believe): it is threatening like fate is threatening
FL.linkedContent: via Benjamin, the threat of the law (to itself and outwards) is neither intimidation nor dissuasion (as pacifists, anarchists or activists believe): it is threatening like fate is threatening

S.content: duplicity of Geist, as its evil ghost, brings forth question: is ash good or evil? whiteness of ash which belongs to destiny consumed and consuming (conflagration of flame)
S.linkedContent: duplicity of Geist, as its evil ghost, brings forth question: is ash good or evil? whiteness of ash which belongs to destiny consumed and consuming (conflagration of flame)

SW.content: signature (operation of poetic writing) must not be absolutely invulnerable: an “I” signs in the place of the wound (the other operates on us w/out knowing)—so virtual that it remains > bears bereaved memory of an unrefusable lesion > seems older than self: you may have forgotten it, but it carries on dictating all the blows of fate (as if we desired even the worst of them)
SW.linkedContent: signature (operation of poetic writing) must not be absolutely invulnerable: an “I” signs in the place of the wound (the other operates on us w/out knowing)—so virtual that it remains > bears bereaved memory of an unrefusable lesion > seems older than self: you may have forgotten it, but it carries on dictating all the blows of fate (as if we desired even the worst of them)

REST.content: for Heidegger, in Origin, the abyss (Abgrund) plays itself out like “veiled” destiny (fatum) which transfixes (transit) being
REST.linkedContent: for Heidegger, in Origin, the abyss (Abgrund) plays itself out like “veiled” destiny (fatum) which transfixes (transit) being

AFR.content: for Condillac, frivolity as structural destiny, original sin > an accident as essential fate
AFR.linkedContent: for Condillac, frivolity as structural destiny, original sin > an accident as essential fate

PSSS.content: these revenants must haunt our debates [Joshua Jung, Moses Freud] > cruel destiny of a proper name
PSSS.linkedContent: these revenants must haunt our debates [Joshua Jung, Moses Freud] > cruel destiny of a proper name

C.content: class is not lacking, it’s at work (series, lineage, rank, hierarchy, etc.) > but what doesn’t come under (n’en relève plus) class is perhaps fate (le sort) > no classification table for fate
C.linkedContent: class is not lacking, it’s at work (series, lineage, rank, hierarchy, etc.) > but what doesn’t come under (n’en relève plus) class is perhaps fate (le sort) > no classification table for fate

ATM.content: for Levinas, in search of God uncontaminated by Being, contact is a priori contamination > graver yet: risk of contamination that surfaces before contact, in necessity of tying interruptions together (insistence of ruptures)
ATM.linkedContent: for Levinas, in search of God uncontaminated by Being, contact is a priori contamination > graver yet: risk of contamination that surfaces before contact, in necessity of tying interruptions together (insistence of ruptures)

ATM.content: contamination is no longer a risk but a fate that must be assumed
ATM.linkedContent: contamination is no longer a risk but a fate that must be assumed

SPEC.content: [re: Freud’s Beyond…] passage btwn transference & speculation > speculative transference orients, destines, calculates most original & most passive “first step” on very threshold of perception: desire for concept of perception belongs to destiny of this calculation
SPEC.linkedContent: [re: Freud’s Beyond…] passage btwn transference & speculation > speculative transference orients, destines, calculates most original & most passive “first step” on very threshold of perception: desire for concept of perception belongs to destiny of this calculation
